Name Tutor

Details Concept Markup
Description The RascalTutor is an interactive learning environment intended to create and follow interactive courses related to the Rascal language. It is based on the following principles and ideas:
  • The basic notion is a concept. Each concept has a name and contains a fixed set of subsections that describe it.
  • A course is a concept tree: The central subject of the course is the root of the concept tree, and all subtrees further explain their parent concept.
  • Editing of concepts is really simple; it can be done directly from a browser and we use a wiki-like form of markup that makes it easy to create good looking concept pages.
  • All code examples are run when a concept is turned into an HTML page.
  • We check what we can to control the quality of the concept descriptions.
